column4: hi.. i've just compile a custom kernel, using the linux-source package, but now the ubuntu splash dont show up anymore.. anyone has an ideia why?
'sudo update-alternatives --config usplash-artwork.so' and choose the one you want
that will show you a menu with options to choose which usplash to use
and you might need to do 'sudo dpkg-reconfigure linux-image-$(uname -r)' after but not sure about it.
i had a similar problem after trying kubuntu-desktop package, couldn't get the regular ubuntu-usplash back i did those 2 then it was fine again.
another strange thing is that the rt2570 module is not compile, even though it is selectec.. but I think that is normal, cause I'm using smp
have you changed kernel or something perhaps? and missed out restricted modules for your new kernel?
I've done a make menuconfig, removed things that I'll not use.. but left rt2570 alone
but I'll not use rt2570, cause it does not support smp, that I use.. I'll try the open source one.. if nothing works, I'll get back to ndiswrapper, that worked like a charm on a fedora box
